scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name: I have a blank site in "omega(beta)"
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have a blank site in "(.*)"$!) do |path|
  unless File.exist?(path)
    then FileUtils.mkdir_p(path)
  end
end

scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name: I have an "omega(beta)/test.md" page with layout "simple" that contains "Hello World"
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have an? "(.*)" page(?: with (.*) "(.*)")? that contains "(.*)"$!) do |file, key, value, text|
  File.write(file, <<~DATA)
    ---
    #{key || "layout"}: #{value || "none"}
    ---

    #{text}
  DATA
end

scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name: I have an omega(beta)/_includes directory
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have an? (.*) directory$!) do |dir|
  unless File.directory?(dir)
    then FileUtils.mkdir_p(dir)
  end
end

scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name: I have an "omega(beta)/_includes/head.html" file that contains "Snippet"
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have an? "(.*)" file that contains "(.*)"$!) do |file, text|
  File.write(file, text)
end

scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name: I have a configuration file with "source" set to "omega(beta)"
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have a configuration file with "(.*)" set to "(.*)"$!) do |key, value|
  config = \
    if source_dir.join("_config.yml").exist?
      SafeYAML.load_file(source_dir.join("_config.yml"))
    else
      {}
    end
  config[key] = SafeYAML.load(value)
  Jekyll.set_timezone(value) if key == "timezone"
  File.write("_config.yml", YAML.dump(config))
end

scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name: I have an omega(beta)/_layouts directory
glue_code:

  end

scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name: I have an "omega(beta)/_layouts/simple.html" file that contains "{% include head.html %}: {{ content }}"
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have an? "(.*)" file that contains "(.*)"$!) do |file, text|
  File.write(file, text)
end

scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name: I run jekyll build --profile
glue_code:
When(%r!^I run jekyll(.*)$!) do |args|
  run_jekyll(args)
  if args.include?("--verbose") || ENV["DEBUG"]
    warn "\n#{jekyll_run_output}\n"
  end
end

scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name: I should get a zero exit status
glue_code:
Then(%r!^I should get a zero exit(?:-| )status$!) do
  step %(I should see "EXIT STATUS: 0" in the build output)
end

scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name:
I should see "Snippet:

Hello World

" in "_site/test.html"
glue_code:
Then(%r!^I should (not )?see "(.*)" in "(.*)"$!) do |negative, text, file|
  step %(the "#{file}" file should exist)
  regexp = Regexp.new(text, Regexp::MULTILINE)
  if negative.nil? || negative.empty?
    expect(file_contents(file)).to match regexp
  else
    expect(file_contents(file)).not_to match regexp
  end
end

scenario: Rendering a site with parentheses in its path name
step_name: I should see "_layouts/simple.html" in the build output
glue_code:
Then(%r!^I should (not )?see "(.*)" in the build output$!) do |negative, text|
  if negative.nil? || negative.empty?
    expect(jekyll_run_output).to match Regexp.new(text)
  else
    expect(jekyll_run_output).not_to match Regexp.new(text)
  end
end

scenario: When receiving bad Liquid
step_name: I have a "index.html" page with layout "simple" that contains "{% include invalid.html %}"
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have an? "(.*)" page(?: with (.*) "(.*)")? that contains "(.*)"$!) do |file, key, value, text|
  File.write(file, <<~DATA)
    ---
    #{key || "layout"}: #{value || "none"}
    ---

    #{text}
  DATA
end

scenario: When receiving bad Liquid
step_name: I have a simple layout that contains "{{ content }}"
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have an? (.*) (layout|theme) that contains "(.*)"$!) do |name, type, text|
  folder = type == "layout" ? "_layouts" : "_theme"

  destination_file = Pathname.new(File.join(folder, "#{name}.html"))
  FileUtils.mkdir_p(destination_file.parent) unless destination_file.parent.directory?
  File.write(destination_file, text)
end

scenario: Render liquid in Sass
step_name: I have a configuration file with "color" set to "red"
glue_code:
Given(%r!^I have a configuration file with "(.*)" set to "(.*)"$!) do |key, value|
  config = \
    if source_dir.join("_config.yml").exist?
      SafeYAML.load_file(source_dir.join("_config.yml"))
    else
      {}
    end
  config[key] = SafeYAML.load(value)
  Jekyll.set_timezone(value) if key == "timezone"
  File.write("_config.yml", YAML.dump(config))
end

step_name: I should not see "content\": \"__Hello World__" in "_site/test.json"
glue_code:
Then(%r!^I should (not )?see "(.*)" in "(.*)"$!) do |negative, text, file|
  step %(the "#{file}" file should exist)
  regexp = Regexp.new(text, Regexp::MULTILINE)
  if negative.nil? || negative.empty?
    expect(file_contents(file)).to match regexp
  else
    expect(file_contents(file)).not_to match regexp
  end
end
